intro: Niphogeton jahnii, commonly known as the Jahn's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. The plant features upright stems with opposite, ovate leaves that are typically covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family, and are often yellowish-green in color. Niphogeton jahnii is often found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
